title: Biden Administration Seeks to Expand Wind Farms in Coastal Waters
sub_head: U.S. aims for projects off Atlantic Coast, Pacific Coast and in Gulf of Mexico
body:
WASHINGTONâ€”The Biden administration is preparing to open up large sections of the U.S. coastline to wind-turbine projects as part of a plan to boost production of clean, renewable energy.
The U.S. is aiming by 2025 to lease up to seven tracts for wind farms in coastal waters between Maine and the Carolinas on the Atlantic Coast, off California and Oregon along the Pacific Coast and in the Gulf of Mexico, Interior Department Secretary Deb Haaland said.
